zone.line: Whose many-voiced Echoes thro the mist
Of cataracts, flung the thunder of that spell;
Ye icy Springs stagnant with wrinkling frost
Which vibrated to hear me, & then crept

Shuddering through India; &
t T hou pure serenest Air
Through which the Sun walks burning without
beams,
And ye swift Whirlwinds who on poised wings
Hung mute & moveless oer yon hushed abyss
As thunder louder than your own made rock
The orbed world — if then my words had power,
—Though I am changed so that aught evil wish
Is dead within, although no memory be
Of what is hate — let them not lose it now!
What was that curse? for ye all heard me speak
1st. Voice from the Mountains
Thrice three hundred thousand years
Oe'r the Earthquakes couch we stood;
Oft as men convulsed with fears
We trembled in our multitude.
2d. Voice from the Springs
Thunderbolts had parched our water,
78 We had been stained with bitter blood
